Consider a regular n-gon (a polygon with n sides) with side length 1. 
Find the maximum number of non-overlapping triangles that can be formed inside this n-gon using triangulation. 
Express your answer in terms of n.
message_2:
To maximize the number of non-overlapping triangles inside the regular n-gon, we can use the process of triangulation. Triangulation involves connecting non-adjacent vertices with non-intersecting line segments to divide the polygon into triangles.

For an n-gon, we can form a triangle by selecting any three non-adjacent vertices. After forming the first triangle, we are left with an (n-1)-gon. We can continue this process until we are left with a triangle.

In general, an n-gon can be divided into (n-2) non-overlapping triangles. This can be seen by considering that each time we form a triangle, we reduce the number of sides of the polygon by 1. We can continue this process until we are left with a triangle (3-gon), which requires (n-2) steps.

So, the maximum number of non-overlapping triangles that can be formed inside a regular n-gon using triangulation is (n-2).
